taxonomicnotes: Horadandia atukorali was originally described from Sri Lanka by Deraniyagala in 1943. Horadandia atukorali brittani, was decribed by Rema Devi & Menon (1992) as a new subspecies. But this was synonymised with Horadandia atukorali by Kottelat and Vidthyanon (1993).
rationale: Horadandia atukorali is widely distributed along the southern Indian and Sri Lankan coastal belt.  Although several threats have been identified for this species, especially conversion of habitats and introduction of exotics, it is presumed to be surviving in its range as it is found abundantly where it occurs.  It is therefore assessed as Least Concern.  It is recommended that further studies into its distribution and impact of threats on the population be taken up soon as this species may be more threatened than what is understood today.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Gopalakrishnan, A., Arunachalam, M., Shrikant, J., Johnson, J.A., Rahul, K. & Molur, S.
